title: Mastering MinLOS: How to Optimize Your Restrictions for Maximum Revenue
description: Our reader asked: “How can we correctly and timely manage the minimum length of stay restriction?” Here’s the answer.
content: Effective Minimum Stay Restriction Rules (MinLOS) management is aboutapplying restrictions strategicallyto control guest booking behavior and optimize occupancy. Here’s how to get it right: - Anticipate demand patterns:Use your property data and market trends to predict peak and low-demand periods. Apply MinLOS during high-demand times (e.g., holidays, major events) to prioritize longer stays and maximize revenue. - Balance restrictions with flexibility:Overusing MinLOS can deter bookings. Combine strategic restrictions with flexibility to capture short-stay demand when necessary. - Dynamic adjustments:Regularly review and adjust your MinLOS settings in real-time based on booking pace and market conditions. Sticking to static rules can result in missed opportunities or unsold rooms. - Consider room type:Apply MinLOS selectively to your most popular or premium room categories. ## Three Strategies to Optimize Your MinLOS 1. Offer Discounted Rates to Encourage Longer Stays Instead of strictly enforcing stay restrictions,incentivize longer staysby offering targeted discounts. For example, a 10% discount on stays of three nights or more can encourage guests to extend their visits. 2. Focus on High-Demand Room Types Not every room needs the same strategy. To maximize profit, apply MinLOS to your most popular or premium room categories during peak seasons. Keep other room types available for shorter stays to capture spontaneous bookings and last-minute demand. 3. Plus, our upcoming features will offer even more automation, includingcustom rule creationand aminimum length of stayrestriction recommendationsbased on market demand. ## How To Correctly And Timely Manage Minimum Length Of Stay Restriction Effective MinLOS management requiresreal-time data analysis, strategic application, and flexibility. Applying restrictions too early or too broadly can deter bookings, while reactive adjustments ensure you capture demand and maximize revenue.
